Notice Information
=====================

* **Title**: Asphalt Repairs Bank/Vittoria
* **Reference Number**: PW-_PPS-028-28785

* **Publication Date**: August 23, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: September 14, 2022, 14:00:00
* **Contracting Entity**: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* **Project Location**: Parliamentary Precinct (Bank & Vittoria St.), 229 Wellington St, Ottawa, Ontario
* **Contact Person**: Mike Stirling, [mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca), (873) 354-0010
* **Trade Agreement**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

Project Description
-------------------

The project consists of repairing damaged asphalt sections on Bank Street and Vittoria Street in the Parliamentary Precinct. The work must be completed within 8 weeks of contract award.

**Note:** The closing date has been extended to September 14, 2022.

**Security Requirements:**

*   Contractor personnel requiring access to secure sites must hold a valid Site Access Clearance, granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services (PWGSC).
*   The Contractor must comply with the provisions of the Security Requirements Check List and security guide (if applicable), attached at Annex A.

Bid Submission and Evaluation
-----------------------------

*   Firms interested in submitting bids must obtain bid documents through the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders).
*   Bid documents must be submitted electronically through the CPC Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation.
*   The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
*   Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Enquiries:**

*   All enquiries are to be submitted to the Contractual Authority: Mike Stirling, by email at [mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:mike.stirling@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).
*   Enquiries are to be made in writing and should be received no less than five (3) business days prior to the closing date to allow sufficient time to respond.
